t: For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Rescue*pn me, Lord,*s from evildoers; protect*ld me from the violent,
who*ln devise evil plans in their hearts and*ld stir up war every day.
They*ln make their tongues as sharp as a serpent’s; the*ld poison of vipers is on their lips.
Keep*pn me safe, Lord,*s from the hands of the wicked; protect*ld me from the violent, who*ld devise ways to trip my feet.
The*ln arrogant have hidden a snare for me; they*ld have spread out the cords of their net and*ld have set traps for me along my path.
I*pn say to the Lord,*s “You are my God.” Hear,*ld Lord,*s my cry for mercy.
Sovereign*ln Lord,*s my strong deliverer, you*ld shield my head in the day of battle.
Do*ln not grant the wicked their desires, Lord;*s do*ld not let their plans succeed.
Those*pn who surround me proudly rear their heads; may*ld the mischief of their lips engulf them.
May*ln burning coals fall on them; may*ld they be thrown into the fire, into*ld miry pits, never to rise.
May*ln slanderers not be established in the land; may*ld disaster hunt down the violent.
I*pn know that the Lord*s secures justice for the poor and*ld upholds the cause of the needy.
Surely*ln the righteous will praise your name, and*ld the upright will live in your presence.
